page.title: 14Hutton & Gillamoor Churches
page.content: St. Chad's which celebrated it's 50th. anniversary in 1984, is the only place of worship in Hutton-le-Hole and is joined by sister churches in Rosedale and Cropton within the parish of Lastingham. The present incumbent is the Rev Francis Hewitt and communion to the sick is given by retired clergyman Canon Broughton. Services are Holy Communion each Sunday with Evensong on the second Sunday. Attendance averages 14. Gillamoor has two places of worship, Methodist & St. Aidan, Anglican, a daughter church of All Saints, Kirkbymoorside. It stands at the east end of the village over- looking Surprise View. Their average attendance is 21 and the Methodist is 11. A Chapel Anniversary Service is held each year. The nearest Roman Catholic Church is in Kirkby- moorside.
